summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary sworn interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) with a Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) employee, Correctional Counselor (formerly Lieutenant) , regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York on August 10, 2019. The interview covers the interviewee's role, procedures at MCC, the events surrounding Epstein's death, staffing issues, and systemic problems.

events.title: Efrain Reyes Transferred from MCC
events.description: Inmate Efrain Reyes, Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate, is transferred out of MCC (status: WAB - With All Belongings) at approximately 8:38 a.m. Epstein is left without a cellmate, contrary to requirements due to his high-profile status and prior suicide attempt.

events.title: Last Sighting of Epstein Alive
events.description: On the evening of August 9, around 9:50-9:55 p.m., BOP employee is about to escort Epstein from attorney conferences back to SHU. intervenes, stating he will take Epstein up and give him a legal call. This is the last time sees Epstein alive.

events.title: Discovery of Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is found deceased in his SHU cell at MCC New York in the early morning hours. The death is discovered by staff during morning rounds.

events.title: Notification and Hospital Response
events.description: At approximately 6:30-6:45 a.m., Lieutenant calls and informs him of Epstein's suicide attempt, directing him to go straight to Bellevue Hospital. At the hospital, escorting staff inform that Epstein has passed away.

events.title: Epstein's First Alleged Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's first alleged suicide attempt while incarcerated at MCC. He was cellmates with Nicholas Tartaglione at the time.

events.title: Prior Suicide at MCC
events.description: recalls a suicide that took place in the MCC SHU in 2003, where an inmate with a cellmate successfully hanged himself. The officer in charge was suspended because rounds were not made within the required 30-40 minute timeframe.

events.description: The Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General conducts a voluntary sworn interview with BOP employee at MCC New York as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.

keyFacts: The interviewee, a former lieutenant, states he was unaware that Epstein's cellmate, Efrain Reyes, had been transferred out of MCC on the morning of August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein without a required cellmate. He believes he should have been notified.

The interviewee's signature appears on SHU round sheets for August 9, 2019, but he repeatedly states he does not remember signing them and insists he did not make rounds in the SHU that night, suggesting a possible discrepancy or falsification.

The interviewee describes systemic problems at MCC including severe staff shortages, excessive overtime leading to exhausted 'zombie' staff, and inconsistent staffing in critical posts like the SHU, which he implies contributed to security failures.

The interviewee reveals that on the night before Epstein's death, another staff member, , intervened to escort Epstein back to his cell and grant him a 'legal call,' which was the last time the interviewee saw Epstein alive.

The interview reveals confusion and possible falsification of count documents for the SHU on the night of Epstein's death, with mismatched numbers between count slips, E-1 forms, and the lieutenant's log, including unexplained 'plus 1' notations.
